div.p: Minimum spanning network for Haemoproteus and Plasmodium mitochondrial DNA cytochrome b haplotypes detected in four species of passerines from Georgia (USA). Circles are drawn proportional to the frequency at which haplotypes were observed. Color represents the host species from which haplotypes originated: red for Northern Cardinal ( Cardinalis cardinalis), blue for Indigo Bunting ( Passerina cyanea), yellow for White-throated Sparrow ( Zonotrichia albicollis), and grey for Tufted Titmouse ( Baeolophus bicolor). A single mutation separates nodes unless explicitly indicated by number. Letters within each node refer to Table 8 which indicates the haplotype name, sampling location, and other factors associated with hosts.
